message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and imaging findings suggest Meckel's diverticulum, which arises from the vitelline duct (also known as the omphalomesenteric duct) during embryonic development. The other options are not associated with this condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the pertechnetate scintigraphy suggest Meckel diverticulum, which arises from the remnants of the vitelline duct. None of the other options are associated with this condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and imaging findings suggest Meckel’s diverticulum, which is a remnant of the vitelline duct. The other options are not related to this condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The clinical description matches that of Meckel's diverticulum, which arises from the vitelline duct. The other options are associated with the development of the urinary system (metanephric mesenchyme), cardiovascular system (ductus arteriosus), and reproductive system (paramesonephric duct), but are not relevant to this patient's condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and scintigraphy suggest Meckel’s diverticulum, which arises from the persistence of the vitelline duct. The other options are associated with the development of kidneys, heart, and reproductive organs.
